intro: Saccolabium galeatum, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Saccolabium galeatum is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping.
